aboutMe.subtitle: Freelance Copywriter | Corporate Communications Leader | Journalist
bio: I am a journalist, corporate communications specialist, and freelance copywriter. Across diverse industries, I have authored dozens of results-driven contents and thus, delivering powerful insight into various, yet important areas of the economic well-being of individuals, groups and corporate entities, though specializing in insurance, maritime, and SMEs content. Over the years, I have written hundreds of articles, stories and features. These works provide insightful analysis, engaging narratives and compelling storytelling that have contributed to shaping public opinion, policies of state and non-state actors.

The experiences of the past three decades in journalism and corporate communications have now been consolidated into copywriting and helping organizations to grow their business in measurable and impactful ways.

In addition to an extensive writing career, I have also led a corporate communications team at a prominent insurance company, where we played a pivotal role in managing brands and reputation, overseeing website content, and enhancing marketing and sales initiatives. As a team leader, I was responsible for shaping the company's internal and external communication strategies, directing the execution of sales copies, email campaigns, content for landing pages and other messaging tools. Our approach was deeply rooted in aligning messaging with both organizational goals and customer needs, ensuring clarity and consistency across all channels.

As a freelance copywriter, I partner with medium and small businesses to amplify their market presence, increase sales, and drive revenue growth. By crafting targeted copies for websites, emails, blogs, and more, I help businesses to reach their potential and connect with consumers in a meaningful way.

copywritingAI.title: Copywriting and AI: My Take
paragraphs: Quite a significant number of professionals now assume that with innovative AI tools, copywriters’ jobs will be wiped away. They posit that better copies are churned out in minutes by these tools. AIs, even with artificial human intelligence, will continue to be a form of machine learning. Business interactions, whether B2B or B2C will always require human intelligence.

Despite its impressive applications, AI is based on programmed predictive behavior, patterns, and trends. Human behavioral psychology is highly dynamic, and what is accurate one day may change the next. Artificial intelligence can help the copywriter overcome mental block and occasional lack of inspiration. It requires the human mind to navigate it towards maximum output.

Yes, AI is an important tool and performs extremely well in the hands of people who are mastering its application in various ways. It can be used to track buying behavior but unable to execute real-time changes and shifts that are human nature.

quote.speaker: Keanu Reeves
quote.text: “But will a machine ever know what it feels like to miss something? Or what is it like to create something beautiful out of a moment of sorrow? Creativity does not arise from calculation but from experience, pain, love, and hope.”

copywritingAI.closing: In our mindless ambition for technological advancement, illusion about controlling the world and desire to conquer new frontiers and create new markets, Keanu Reeves reminded us that what defines us as humans, our deepest values cannot be programmed or coded. It must be expressed from within our innermost being. So, I write copy for the moment, the future and incorporating historical perspectives!

copywriting.title: Copywriting: The Art of Persuasion
paragraphs: Copywriting is the art of persuasion. It is a skill that requires a deep understanding of human psychology, behavior, and emotions. A good copywriter knows how to tap into these elements to create compelling messages that resonate with the target audience.

The goal of copywriting is to persuade the reader to take action, whether it’s making a purchase, signing up for a newsletter, or clicking on a link. This requires a clear understanding of the target audience and their needs, desires, and pain points.

quote.speaker: David Ogilvy
quote.text: “The consumer isn’t a moron; she is your wife.”

copywriting.closing: In conclusion, copywriting is not just about writing words on a page. It’s about understanding the audience and crafting messages that resonate with them. It’s about creating a connection that leads to action.

contentStrategy.title: Content Strategy: The Key to Success
paragraphs: A well-defined content strategy is essential for any business looking to succeed in today’s digital landscape. It involves creating a plan for how to create, publish, and manage content that aligns with the business goals and objectives.

A good content strategy takes into account the target audience, their needs and preferences, and the channels through which they consume content. It also involves creating a consistent brand voice and messaging that resonates with the audience.

quote.speaker: Ann Handley
quote.text: “Good content isn’t about good storytelling. It’s about telling a true story well.”

contentStrategy.closing: In conclusion, a well-defined content strategy is essential for any business looking to succeed in today’s digital landscape. It helps to create a consistent brand voice and messaging that resonates with the audience.

emailMarketing.title: Email Marketing: The Power of Personalization
paragraphs: Email marketing is one of the most effective ways to reach and engage with customers. It allows businesses to communicate directly with their audience and build relationships over time.
Personalization is key to successful email marketing. By tailoring messages to the individual recipient, businesses can create a more meaningful connection and increase engagement.

quote.speaker: Seth Godin
quote.text: “Marketing is no longer about the stuff you make, but about the stories you tell.”

emailMarketing.closing: In conclusion, email marketing is a powerful tool for building relationships with customers. By personalizing messages and creating compelling content, businesses can increase engagement and drive sales.
